intro_text: The patrol comes across a yeek.
decline_text: The patrol decides to look for other prey.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol catches the yeek!

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol narrowly misses the yeek.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a little scavenger nest on the prairie while hunting. Next to it, a strange tower makes a soft thump, its wooden leaves circling slowly in the wind.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol has a successful hunt, avoiding any scavengers.
The patrol finds some astonishingly fat eggbugs running around the scavenger nest and helps themselves to one.

fail_outcomes.text: scavenger slugpups scare the patrol away.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger slugpups wandering around are unimpressed by the patrol and chase the slugcats for fun.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A scavenger slugpup approaches the patrol, and they send it away squawking with its blood on their spears.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a little scavenger nest on the prairie while hunting. Next to it, a strange tower makes a soft thump, its leaves circling slowly in the wind.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol slugcats split up, using sentries to ensure that the scavenger don't disturb their hunts.
The patrol finds some astonishingly fat eggbugs running around the scavenger nest and helps themselves to as many as they can carry.

fail_outcomes.text: scavenger slugpups stomp through the long grass, scaring away prey and ruining the hunt.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger slugpups wandering around are unimpressed by the patrol and chase the slugcats for fun.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Finding a scavenger slugpup wandering alone, the slugcats harass it until it flees squawking, its blood on their spears.

intro_text: As the patrol travels the territory, they come upon a strange metal forest that the scavengers have built.  Smooth, white tree trunks rise up into the sky, completely bare apart from the very top, where three massive branches grow outwards and spin in slow circles. A low hum permeates the air.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere

success_outcomes.text: The patrol moves among the white trunks, checking the ground underneath them.  Sometimes dead batflies can be found scattered about in this area and if not yet rotten, make for acceptable fresh-kill.  They manage to find some carcasses worth taking.
This place is unnerving and the patrol hunts carefully and cautiously, keeping an eye out for scavengers all the while.

fail_outcomes.text: This place is unnerving and the patrol can't stand the tense atmosphere and grating, constant noise. They don't stay long enough to find prey.

The patrol considers their options. s_c is adamant that they find somewhere else to hunt. It's not safe here and the threat of scavengers is too high. They decide to move on but struggle to find any prey during the rest of the patrol.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The atmosphere in this place is eerie and r_c takes out {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tenseness on one of the white trunks.  A few shallow scrapes are left on the surface, but little other evidence of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} aggression remains.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol is frustrated by this seemingly permanent proof of scavenger on their territory and takes the time to thoroughly and aggressively mark the area. There. That will show the scavenger whose land this is.

intro_text: The patrol finds a small burrow in the ground with a strange scent. They hesitate, unsure if this is worth checking.
decline_text: The patrol decides to avoid the burrow. There's no telling what could await inside.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol flushes a few yeeks out of the burrow! More fresh-kill!
Inside the burrow is a eggbug, curled up and alone. Perhaps a youngling recently kicked from his birth warren? Whatever the case, this eggbug will feed the Clan now.

fail_outcomes.text: The burrow turns out to be empty - the smell nothing but stale air and a slight tang of sickness. Whatever used to live here is gone now. Checking the burrow was a waste of time.
s_c sticks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose into the hole only to come face to face with a whole patch of spore puffs! The whole patrol is covered in stinky spores!

Oh no! The burrow was home to a black lizard, now angry at the disturbance. The patrol bolts away to escape its wrath, but r_c doesn't quite move fast enough and is caught in its jaws until another slugcat turns back to help.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after an unfortunate encounter with a black lizard.

intro_text: The patrol finds a small burrow in the ground with a strange scent. They hesitate, unsure if this is worth checking.
decline_text: The patrol decides to avoid the burrow. There's no telling what could await inside.

success_outcomes.text: r_c flushes a few yeeks out of the burrow! More fresh-kill!

fail_outcomes.text: The burrow turns out to be empty - the smell nothing but stale air and a slight tang of sickness. Whatever used to live here is gone now. Checking the burrow was a waste of time.
s_c sticks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose into the hole only to come face to face with a whole patch of spore puffs! The whole patrol is covered in stinky spores!

Oh no! The burrow was home to a black lizard, now angry at the disturbance. r_c bolts away to escape its wrath, but doesn't quite move fast enough and is caught in its jaws.  With no other slugcats around to help, r_c is quickly killed by the predator.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed after an unfortunate experience with a black lizard.

intro_text: The patrol looks around for something to disguise their scent while hunting.
decline_text: On second thought, maybe not.

success_outcomes.text: They can't think of anything that would work, but their hunt goes well regardless.
A fragrant shrub will do! The plan works, and their hunt goes well.
s_c leads them to some eggbug droppings in the grass - it's not clean, but it's extremely effective, and the patrol hunts well.
s_c tells the patrol to roll in a patch of garlic to disguise their scent, which works perfectly. It's a funny taste to wash off their pelts though.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol finds nothing to disguise their scent, and no prey either.
The patrol finds no prey; it seems like all the prey was scared off because of their stench!

intro_text: r_c looks around for something to disguise {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} scent while hunting.
decline_text: On second thought, maybe not.

success_outcomes.text: They can't think of anything that would work, but their hunt goes well regardless.
s_c finds some eggbug droppings in the grass - it's not clean, but it's extremely effective, and the hunt goes well.
s_c rolls in a patch of garlic to disguise their scent, which works perfectly. It's a funny taste to wash off their pelt though.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol finds nothing to disguise their scent, and no prey either.
r_c finds no prey; it seems like all the prey was scared off because of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} stench!

intro_text: r_c's mentor assesses {PRONOUN/r_c/object} by sending {PRONOUN/r_c/object} on a solo hunt.
decline_text: r_c asks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor to do the assessment some other time.

success_outcomes.text: r_c manages a skillful catch, and brings it back to the camp to show everyone!

r_c focuses completely on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} test, slipping into a cleareyed, focused routine of catch and stash, catch and stash. Eventually {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} caught enough to need {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor's help carrying it back to camp, and the feeling seeing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prey stock the fresh-kill pile - {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} ready to burst with happiness!

It's a terrible day for hunting, the prey running sparse and alert. But s_c takes {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} time and doesn't let the conditions discourage {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, until eventually the right opportunity presents itself and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pull/pulls} off a perfect catch!

fail_outcomes.text: Hunting is poor, and while r_c's mentor is disappointed, they don't expect r_c to catch what isn't there.

s_c is too hasty, bouncing after first one prey, then another, and it ends with {PRONOUN/s_c/object} empty-pawed and exhausted. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} mentor is disappointed - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} clearly need more training.

While on the hunt, r_c tumbles right down an empty green lizard sett while {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} attention is elsewhere. Bruised and sore, r_c has to report to the cleric den when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured as an apprentice, exploring alone.

intro_text: r_c heads out onto the plains alone, wanting to sink {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} teeth into some prey and have some time to {PRONOUN/r_c/self}.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that a group hunt would be more effective.

success_outcomes.text: r_c heads off to one of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} favorite spots in the grasslands, a trench running along in a winding line across a productive and lush field providing excellent ambush chances. And what do you know - {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} bush! Or {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was}, as far as that lantern mouse thought.

r_c finds a fat, dumb, slow eggbug, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can barely drag the thing back to camp, but Void it's juicy when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/sit/sits} down to eat it with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates.

s_c gets the chance to try out an idea {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'ve/'s} been sitting on for a while. There's a eggbug warren that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'ve/'s} spotted that's particularly badly built, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/dig/digs} down into one of the dens, fishing baby eggbugs out by the pawful.

The prey is running terribly today. But s_c has patience, and wisely waits for the perfect opportunity instead of getting frustrated. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/come/comes} back to camp with a good contribution to the Clan's stores, having had a relaxing day sitting with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} thoughts while waiting for the prey to come to {PRONOUN/s_c/object}.

fail_outcomes.text: You can't catch what isn't there, and the prey today is certainly not there.
s_c starts the day with endless energy, but as one hunt fails after another, it very quickly runs dry. The come back to camp, empty-pawed and prickling with frustration.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from the long grass nearby.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: r_c drops down into a hunting crouch, certain that a yeek must be the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to be correct when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} into the grass and return to the patrol with the tasty morsel dangling from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} jaws.
p_l pads towards the grass to check on the noise when a eggbug bursts out! s_c is quick to react and snags the eggbug before it can disappear.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l pads closer to the grass, intent on finding the source of the noise, only to punce on a patch of sporepuffs! The poor slugcat ends up stinking for days after the unfortunate incident.

s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly regret {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry baby lizard bursts from the grass, chattering loudly! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the lizard only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and quickly runs off back into the grass.

r_c takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with an angry lizard! Though {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/backpedal/backpedals} rapidly, the lizard still gets its teeth into {PRONOUN/r_c/object} before the rest of the patrol can back {PRONOUN/r_c/object} up.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar from a lizard.

intro_text: The patrol encounters a patch of bare ground where a lot of scavenger linger.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: They continue hunting undetected.

Slyly, r_c uses the chance to get food, practicing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} best pet impression until just the right moment, when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/dart/darts} forward and {VERB/r_c/make/makes} off with a sandwich in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth.
s_c spots the scavenger unloading metal boxes from their monsters, and abruptly tells the patrol they need to leave. Now.
A scavenger spots s_c and crouches down, clicking softly. s_c hisses and flees.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol mostly ignores the scavenger. As they hunt, they hear a yelp from r_c. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} crawled into a metal scavenger box, and there's nothing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} or the rest of the patrol can do to get {PRONOUN/r_c/object} out - eventually the scavenger notice, and r_c is taken by them.

A scavenger spots s_c and crouches down, clicking softly. s_c pauses - are they hurt? Do they want to make friends? Before {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} can decide whether to step closer, there's a swoosh, and a net falls around {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. s_c fights desperately, but the scavengers take {PRONOUN/s_c/object} away.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol mostly ignores the scavenger. But as they hunt, the slugcats encounter delicious-smelling mush in little burrows. Some of the patrol investigates, and doors slam down behind them. There's nothing they or the rest of the patrol can do to get them out - eventually the scavenger notice, and the trapped slugcats are taken.

A scavenger spots s_c and crouches down, clicking softly. s_c pauses - are they hurt? Do they want to make friends? {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/wander/wanders} closer, drawing more of the patrol in with {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. Before they can decide whether to step away, there's a swoosh, and a net falls around the slugcats. They fight desperately, but the scavengers take them away.

intro_text: r_c decides to hunt out near the scavenger dens.
decline_text: On second thought, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/decide/decides} to re-line {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest today instead.

success_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} interrupted by scavenger wandering through the woods a couple times, but it's a successful hunt.

A friendly scavenger makes a psspsspss noise, and pours pet food on the ground for r_c. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} always wondered what it might taste like... dry is the answer. Very odd.

s_c gets distracted from hunting by strange scavenger activity around one of their dens. They appear to be to be hauling all their many, many varieties of nest lining out and into a big miros bird. s_c takes the opportunity to grab a little soft thing, something that's almost shaped like prey. It'll be good for the nursery.
Calmly, s_c weaves around the scavenger dens, picking out the lantern mice from the tunnels and the batflies off the strange metal hanging fruit. A successful, sneaky hunt.

fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger here are friendly, and a little carelessly, s_c goes to hunt in their garden. But there's a new thing there: a strange, suspicious box. Wisely, s_c avoids it, and returns to c_n territory.
Carelessly, r_c is seen by a scavenger, and taken from c_n.

Carelessly, r_c is seen by scavenger and locked, hissing and spitting, in a miros bird's den. intro_text: The smell of food lures r_c into what looks like a tunnel under some recently disturbed earth.
decline_text: Turning their nose up at the temptation, they continue on their way.

success_outcomes.text: Darting through quickly, they see that the lovely smell is scavenger mush, and keep running.

The lovely smell leads to scavenger mush. Puzzled, r_c checks around them, only for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelt to prickle with fear as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/realize/realizes} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} standing in a metal tunnel, cloaked in rust and camouflage. It's to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} great fortune that this trap seems to be broken, but whatever scavenger restocked the bait might still be around. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/leave/leaves} quickly.

Something about this situation sets all of s_c's instincts off. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/investigate/investigates}, carefully, and strip the cover of the earth away from a scavenger trap underneath.

Something isn't right. Nervously pawing at the earth, s_c thinks that the smell is too good to be true. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/leave/leaves} it, deciding to return to camp and report it to the deputy instead.

fail_outcomes.text: Easily swayed by the delicious smell, s_c wanders recklessly into the sheltered space, only to smack into a metal wall. intro_text: The patrol comes across a wide open space in the middle of the territory. The jets of vultures echo in the distance, but they're far away. Even so, the patrol can't help but mull over whether or not it's worth crossing to hunt on the other side.
decline_text: They decide it is better not to cross.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol crosses the open space and hunts on the other side.
The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey.

The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey. Upon returning to camp and washing their paws off, r_c finds that theirs have been stained by the mud from the tunnel.

The patrol stops on the edge of the open space, and s_c organizes a thorough search that finds a hidden cache of bluefruit. The emptiness of the space feels unnatural, a warning of the dangers these places bring.
s_c is patient enough to wait until there is definitely no vultures, then trots across to hunt on the other side.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c hears a the jets of a vulture, and ducks into cover just as the jaws snap behind {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail.
r_c is picked up by a vulture, never to be seen again.

history_text.scar: m_c was bitten by a vulture.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was carried away by a vulture.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c is picked up by a vulture, but miraculously gets free! They still fell a long way.

history_text.scar: m_c was heavily injured by a vulture, and carries the scars from it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was dropped by a vulture and killed.

decline_text: The patrol turns away. The risk isn't worth it.

success_outcomes.text: r_c happens to have a pearl on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss}, trading the shiny object for safe passage.
The patrol finds another path instead, finding a good haul for their trouble
s_c stops the patrol, slowly walking up to the scavengers and offering up a stolen pearl. The scavengers fall for it, and the patrol is waved through.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! A spear lands just behind {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail, but {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} get away.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a lizard. Tracking it down, the slugcats spot a young lizard wandering through the grass, carrying a yeek in its jaws.
decline_text: That's an insignificant amount of fresh-kill to start a fight over.

success_outcomes.text: Your hunters chase after it, spitting and hissing as the smaller predator tries to run. But a patrol full of slugcats is faster, and the lizard soon decides that it'd prefer to give up the yeek rather than fight. It's an insignificant amount of fresh-kill, but hopefully a permanent lesson for a lizard on stealing from c_n.
The young lizard isn't crazy, and immediately drops the yeek, running for its life from the patrol.

s_c pounces, snarling, and the lizard turns tail with a yelp. Only s_c isn't alone, and slugcats circle the lizard as it turns and snarls and yelps for mercy, holding it there until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} very sure it will never dare sneak across c_n's borders again.

s_c wanders up to the young lizard, swagger in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} step as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/take/takes} the opportunity to be the bigger predator for once in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life. The slugpup lizard takes one look at the patrol backing s_c up and decides it's time to be elsewhere as fast as its legs can take it, leaving the single skinny yeek it stole behind.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the young lizard, who spots them and sets off at full speed. It's not worth following them, not over a single yeek.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a lizard. Tracking it down, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} a young lizard wandering through the grass, carrying a yeek in its jaws.
decline_text: That's an insignificant amount of fresh-kill to start a fight over.

success_outcomes.text: r_c chases after it, spitting and hissing as the smaller predator tries to run. But r_c is faster, and the lizard soon decides that it'd prefer to give up the yeek rather than fight. Puffed up and proud, r_c trots back to camp with the addition for the fresh-kill pile.

The young lizard locks eyes with r_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/emerge/emerges} from the grass, weighing up its options against the bigger slugcat. There's a long, tense moment as both puff up, ready for a fight, but the lizard's nerve breaks first and it runs, leaving r_c with the yeek.

s_c pounces, snarling, and the lizard turns tail with a yelp. Only s_c uses that moment to grab that fluffy tail and shake, until the lizard gives up its prey and turns to bite. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/dart/darts} backwards, and that's as much fight as the lizard had in them - the lizard runs, and s_c has won the yeek.

s_c wanders up to the young lizard, swagger in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} step as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/take/takes} the opportunity to be the bigger predator for once in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life. It looks like it's going to fight for a second, but s_c's confidence intimidates it into dropping the yeek and fleeing back into the long grass.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c approaches the young lizard, who spots {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and sets off at full speed. It's not worth following them, not over a single yeek.

With a massive yowl, r_c charges the lizard. It bares its teeth, unwilling to give up its hard-won prey without a fight, and one wrong step puts r_c's pelt in range of those little jaws, as the small young lizard tries to live up to the reputation of its bigger and stronger relatives.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a fight with a young lizard.

intro_text: As r_c jumps up onto a rock to survey the plains, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} the pure white pelt of a truly massive white lizard.
decline_text: Not today, thank you - they'll go back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: Swallowing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} instinctive terror, r_c instead crouches to the rock and takes the time to assess the situation. Massive body, and a caramel head - this is too big to be a white lizard, but ironically is less dangerous then it's smaller lizard counterpart.

No way, these things are barely ever seen! The hunting around here will already be ruined by the other predator, so r_c feels no guilt in hanging around to watch the caramel lizard, thinking of the stories {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll tell back at camp.

With a huff, r_c accepts that this hunt has failed - the massive caramel lizard, despite every appearance, hunts nearly identical prey to c_n. Still, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} not one to give up on an opportunity to learn, and sit and watch the lizard pounce for mice in case there might be tips to pick up.

fail_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/poss/CAP} jolt of fear gives them strength, and r_c is most of the way home before it occurs to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that the huge creature might have been too big to be a white lizard.
r_c doesn't know what that creature is, and isn't sticking around to find out! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/run/runs} home, tail between {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} legs.

intro_text: As app1 jumps up onto a rock to survey the plains, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/spot/spots} the pure white pelt of a truly massive white lizard.
decline_text: Not today, thank you - they'll go back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: Terrified beyond sense, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/freeze/freezes} - and the massive lizard sees {PRONOUN/app1/object}. It paces closer, giving app1 a heart-stopping view of its caramel head and giant gaping mouth, gathering itself, before in one might spring, it - crashes past app1 and into the grass. Bobbing back up with a yeek, it makes eye contact with the shivering apprentice, before loping off.

app1 crouches to the rock, but it's too late - the lizard has seen {PRONOUN/app1/object}. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/freeze/freezes} in terror, already sure {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can't outrun the springing legs, sure that at any moment {PRONOUN/app1/subject}'ll be ripped apart and silently begging the Ascended to save {PRONOUN/app1/object}. The closer the lizard gets, the more gigantic it's revealed to be, and it stares down at app1 on the rock, it's head bigger than {PRONOUN/app1/poss} entire body. Only to move on, without a sound.

Slowly, so that the sudden movement doesn't attract attention, app1 lowers themself to the rock. There's something off about the situation here. It's not just a big white lizard, it's impossibly big, with a head brown like the grasses in leaf-bare. Could this be the rare, massive, but mostly harmless caramel lizard that the elders told app1 stories of in the nursery?

fail_outcomes.text: Terror gives app1 strength, and they don't stop running until {PRONOUN/app1/poss} back in camp, gasping about the grassland creature {PRONOUN/app1/subject} saw.

Heart filled with daring, s_c slips off the rock and pads towards the creature in the grass, sure that the Ascended will reward {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} bravery. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/sneak/sneaks} closer and closer, until a puzzle wuff of air makes {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/look/looks} up. And up. And up. That is no white lizard. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/pelt/pelts} for home, as behind {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, a confused caramale lizard watches {PRONOUN/s_c/object} go.

Terror freezes s_c as the massive lizard sees {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, and comes to investigate, its short legs carrying it smoothly through the grass. As the massive nose, as big as app1's entire head, wuffles closer, app1 desperately swipes {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} claws. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} screw {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eyes shut at the outraged yelp, and feel {PRONOUN/s_c/self} being taken up and tossed by those gaping jaws. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/tense/tenses}, waiting for death to descend, and wait, and... waiting?

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from irritating a caramel as an apprentice.

fail_outcomes.text: Heart filled with daring, app1 slips off the rock and pads towards the thing in the grass, sure that the Ascended will reward {PRONOUN/app1/poss} bravery. A surprised wuff of air seems to come from everywhere and nowhere, as the puzzled caramel lizard picks up the apprentice at {PRONOUN/app1/poss} feet and tosses {PRONOUN/app1/object} aside so they can get back to hunting.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from irritating a caramel lizard as an apprentice.

intro_text: This is just one of the weirdest things {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} ever seen, r_c comments to p_l, as the patrol stares at c_n's uninvited guest to their hunting grounds. Are they going to do anything about that... thing?
decline_text: Well, they don't really have time to linger - they'll try another hunting place.

success_outcomes.text: After a good long session of confusion, the patrol manages to work out that the towering creature they're tracking is almost certainly a caramel lizard, a nearly mythical creature. They're all a little uncomfortable, watching an upsized white lizard with unusually long legs amble around their territory, but it's also a little thrilling to follow such an unusual and rarely seen creature.

The rumors are true - it seems to mostly be hunting for tiny yeek prey, not large things, despite its massive size. This must be a caramel lizard, and just being able to name the odd thing makes it feel so much less threatening. The slugcats remind each other of the tales sometimes shared in the nursery, of the tallest predator on the plains being one of the shyest.

s_c is able to recall some of the stories that get told about the caramel lizard, of how it stole its legs from a yeek for speed and power, but in doing so also accidentally took the yeek's flightiness. Ever since then it has been the tallest and shyest creature on the grasslands.

Boldly, s_c jumps down to go check the potential threat out, and unwilling to leave {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmate in danger, the rest of the patrol follows. s_c refuses to let {PRONOUN/s_c/self} be intimidated by the huge lizard thing, and bounds up to it, knowing courage can overcome things raw strength cannot. The weird creature skitters away from the incoming patrol, trotting off.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries, they do, but they can't get a good look at the distorted white lizard creature, and eventually have to return to camp to give a rather unsatisfatory report about it. The slugcats stalk off to do their own things, feeling like they should've been able to do better.
s_c's stressed nerves can't handle this weird creature, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/beg/begs} to go back home instead of confronting it.

intro_text: This is just one of the weirdest things {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} ever seen, r_c comments to p_l, as the patrol stares at c_n's uninvited guest to their hunting grounds. Are they going to do anything about that... thing?
decline_text: Well, they don't really have time to linger - they'll try another hunting place.

success_outcomes.text: Looking out over {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} full six slugcat patrol, p_l decides it's worth it. The slugcats fall into battle, descending onto the caramel lizard and battering it, using teamwork to pull at its long legs and lizard tail, as the lizard turns in skipping circles, yelping. It flees before them, leaving the triumphant slugcats with a single yeek for all that effort. Great.

With a sigh, p_l recognizes that having a caramel lizard poaching from c_n's hunting grounds will become a problem pretty quickly. {PRONOUN/p_l/poss/CAP} six slugcat patrol might be the best way to solve the problem before it begins. All the slugcats, tense and ready, wait to ambush the lizard as it hunts, and manage to drive it out of the territory before it manages to catch more than a yeek. The stolen yeek is returned to c_n's fresh-kill pile, where it belongs.

While {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}'d hardly expected to need {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} skills on a hunting patrol, s_c is able to set up an excellent battle plan. It's only halfway through ambushing the beast that the patrol realizes it's a caramel lizard, which makes {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} job infinitely easier, as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/drive/drives} away the timid predator from c_n territory with enough time left over to bring a yeek or two back for the fresh-kill pile before sundown.

fail_outcomes.text: Looking out over {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} full six slugcat patrol, p_l decides it's worth it. The slugcats fall into battle, descending onto the caramel lizard and battering it, using teamwork to pull at its long legs and lizard tail, as the lizard turns in skipping circles, yelping. It flees before them, leaving the triumphant slugcats with... a fruit? All that effort for a sodding useless fruit?!

With a full patrol, it's possible to take on something the size of a caramel lizard, especially when it has the bravery of a rain deer fawn - but not when s_c attacks with so little forethought, not when the rest of the patrol has to come save {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tail. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/retreat/retreats}, as the increased caramel lizard snarls and the rest of the patrol tries not to do the same at s_c.

Looking out over {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} full six slugcat patrol, p_l decides it's worth it. The slugcats fall into battle, descending onto the caramel lizard and battering it, but a kick from a leg sends slugcats flying, and the lizard manages to whirl to sink its teeth into r_c.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by a caramel lizard, fighting over food.

fail_outcomes.text: With a full patrol, it's possible to take on something the size of a caramel lizard, especially when it has the bravery of a rain deer fawn - but not when s_c attacks with so little forethought, not when the rest of the patrol has to come save {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tail. s_c gets grabbed by those dangerous jaws, and while the patrol is able to mob the lizard until it lets {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} go, it's a serious wound.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by a caramel lizard, fighting over food.

intro_text: This is just weird - what's made the grass here grow to such a uniform low height? Why is it so green? Why has it grown in such a neat circle?
decline_text: Look, app1 knows grass, and this is too weird to want to spend time in. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/head/heads} home without ever seeing the Fresno Nightcrawler.

success_outcomes.text: Okay, app1 knows that scavenger have two legs, but that is just excessive, the scavenger that owns this weird green circle is almost nothing but leg! Friendly though, and they don't try to invade app1's space.

fail_outcomes.text: AH! app1 gets run over by an enormously tall scavenger running in random circles around the green grass.

intro_text: As the patrol moves through the grass just after sunset, two moons rise in the sky...
decline_text: One of those moons has the same metal as a miros bird's jaws, the same glowing eyes that glare from the creatures that kill on the thunderpaths. The slugcats hide from its sight, trembling.

success_outcomes.text: Two whole moons! That's got to be lucky, the slugcats decide, sitting on a little rock still warm from the sun to stargaze.

fail_outcomes.text: One of those moons is getting awfully... close... r_c gets caught in a strange wind that picks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} up, claws scrabbling wildly, sucked towards the frightening foreign moon as it takes {PRONOUN/r_c/object} away from c_n.

intro_text: As the patrol spreads out to hunt, they've got the perfect ambush set up - or they did until someone started talking loudly!
decline_text: Well, this hunt is ruined. Greeeeaaaaat.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol switches to tracking down that annoying voice instead. It takes the rest of the afternoon, and the damn voice tricks p_l into pouncing on r_c, but finally they pin down the talking noodlefly and make it quite clear how irritating he's been.

fail_outcomes.text: The voice is coming from behind that bush! No, that one! No, that one over there, p_l's got them, except what p_l actually has is an irritated r_c's tail, and absolutely no one manages any hunting today. Lizard dung!

intro_text: app1 lines up a perfect run to kill an unwary eggbug, mocking the animal under {PRONOUN/app1/poss} breath.
decline_text: This is too easy - app1 declines to chase it, wanting harder prey.

success_outcomes.text: p_l waves a tail across app1's path, stopping {PRONOUN/app1/object} with a stern stare. Remember those who've been hurt by eggbugs - the wind kicked out of them, their eyes scratched, limping from sharp-toothed bites. app1 nods, and apologies. Every hunt deserves respect.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 leaps forward, feet launching {PRONOUN/app1/self} beautifully. But the eggbug {PRONOUN/app1/object} so mocked squeals, writhing upwards, its clawed hind feet kicking backwards and raking across app1's face.

history_text.scar: r_c was permantly marked by the claws of a eggbug as an apprentice - but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} survived.
history_text.reg_death: r_c died from the claws of a eggbug encountered on a hunt as a foolish apprentice.
history_text.lead_death: from the claws of a eggbug encountered on a hunt as a foolish apprentice
